customer_addr:
P O Box 10
Horse Cave, KY 42749

citations.narrative:
There is no sufficient distance and/or barrier between the public and the camel enclosure. On arrival to the camel's
primary enclosure, he immediately walked over to us to greet us from its shelter. The only thing separating the inspector
from the camel was his primary enclosure fence. This fence has a height above 6 ft. The camel attempted to reach the
inspector by fitting its snout through the chain link fence. Facility representative stated there is no feeding and touching
allowed with the camel. No attendant was observed near the camel enclosure. The absence of a barrier and the lack of
oversight by an attendant increases the risk of harm to the animal and to the public.
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals
and the public.
Correct by January 5, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
There is no sufficient distance and/or barrier between the public and the camel enclosure. On arrival to the camel's 
primary enclosure, he immediately walked over to us to greet us from its shelter. The only thing separating the inspector 
from the camel was his primary enclosure fence. This fence has a height above 6 ft. The camel attempted to reach the 
inspector by fitting its snout through the chain link fence. Facility representative stated there is no feeding and touching 
allowed with the camel. No attendant was observed near the camel enclosure. The absence of a barrier and the lack of 
oversight by an attendant increases the risk of harm to the animal and to the public.  
 
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with 
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals 
and the public. 
 
Correct by January 5, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End Section
